data.title: More script string fixes
data.body: This fixes spelling, punctuation and grammar in TD and RA missions.

data.title: Added support for damage stages to WithSpriteBody and WithTurret
data.body: Allows visible damage stages on non-building sprite actors and turrets.

data.title: Ingame Map Editor - Editor fails to find palette in Map file.
data.body: I have a Tech Power Plant on my map uses CnC template palette on RA mod. They are placed on map but if i open map on editor game crashes and log says Palette `cnc` does not exist. Palette file is in .oramap archive and works when playing. But editor crashes.

data.title: Fix TS maps.
data.body:
- Fixes the incorrectly named TEMPERAT tileset to match the original game.
- Fixes a bug in Map.CenterOfCell that breaks the rendering of heighmapped cells outside the map bounds.
- Reimports the original TS maps using an improved importer that understands resources and cells outside the map bounds.

data.title: D2K - Sardaukars has their own voice but they uses GenericVoice
data.body:
~~Their voice isn't even defined in voices.yaml. But they have their own on orginal D2K.~~

~~Name of voice files are G_SCONF1/2/3 and G_SSEL1/2/3.AUD. But 3. ones sounds like are unused at orginal D2K too. I don't remember them.~~

Never Mind! My mistake. I confused because of name.

data.title: Chronoshiftable Units should not die when chronoshifted inside a Transport
data.body:
To try add `Chronoshiftable:` to an infantry. It chronoes normally but dies when in a transport. Transport boats aren't chronoshiftable so this is not cause any problem for vanilla RA mod. But block me on my map with custom rules.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/22374034-chronoshiftable-units-should-not-die-when-chronoshifted-inside-a-transport?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Don’t switch mods from inside button click handlers.
data.body:
This was super bogus.
Fixes #8371.
Fixes #8500.

data.title: Dispose of a MemoryStream in PackageEntry
data.body: There are probably a couple hundred `MemoryStreams` opened and never disposed of each time a mod loads (later research suggests also when a map is being loaded).

data.title: Player cant join a game when 2 specs or more
data.body:
A new player cant join a game when there are 2 or more specs. Server just shows a chat message: "Server: PlayerXY has disconncted" each time a player tries to connect.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/22267833-player-cant-join-a-game-when-2-specs-or-more?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed infantry prone sequences
data.body:
Code fix:
`WithInfantryBody` now populates `rsm` when infantry is created, rather than in the constructor. This fixes override issues between `WithInfantryBody` and traits implementing `IRenderInfantrySequenceModifier` (currently `TakeCover`, `ScaredyCat`, `WithPermanentInjury`).

Yaml fixes:
- removed `stand2` if it was unused and/or a duplicate of `stand`
- fixed `prone-stand` sequences to define `Stride` instead of `Length`
- added `prone-stand2` (copy-paste of `prone-stand`) to all infantry with `stand2`
- fixed d2k rifle infantry `prone-stand` sequence (it was using standup frames)
- removed now redundant duplicate trait definitions from individual d2k infantry types.*

*I did NOT forget about the other mods, but I'm working on a larger yaml cleanup PR that will adress this for the other mods and want to keep rebase conflicts to a minimum.

Closes #8075.

data.title: Fixed upgrade level tracking
data.body:
Fixes `UpgradeManager` keeping track of traits' upgrade levels cumulatively without keeping track of the individual upgrades' levels.

This has made `GainsStatUpgrades` grant maximum upgrades after only two rank ups.

data.title: TD Minor issues.
data.body:
Infantry no longer prone when shot at. I am unsure if this actually ignores the prone mechanic or an animation glitch. They do however slow walk when shot at which indicates they are supposed to prone. I will test later if they get damage reductions or not.

Unable to double click select same units while in spectator mode or on the enemies units.

(( All of the above I am unsure how to fix myself. I am not good with LUA and animation mechanics. ))

data.title: RA - Soviets have Helipads on Desert Shellmap
data.body: Possibly they are not visible during shellmap is playing but there are 3 Helipads owned by Soviets you can see on editor. Normally Soviets are unable to build helipads. I looked to Lua and they are not used. So i don't see any problem to remove them. I think they was buildable by soviets before like orginal RA and you forgot to remove them on Shellmap.

data.title: Missing dependency mono(ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib) on Fedora 22
data.body:
Release-20150614 fails to install on Fedora 22 due to dependency problems.

Steps to reproduce:

Download Package for Fedora 21 'openra-20150614-1.1.noarch.rpm' from OBS http://software.opensuse.org/download.html?project=games:openra&package=openra as instructed from official page http://www.openra.net/download/ .

"dnf install openra-20150614-1.1.noarch.rpm" returns error due to dependency issue.

```
dnf install openra-20150614-1.1.noarch.rpm
Last metadata expiration check performed 2:51:01 ago on Mon Jun 15 07:10:19 2015.
Error: nothing provides mono(ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib) = 0.86.0.518 needed by openra-20150614-1.1.noarch
```

```
mono --version
Mono JIT compiler version 4.0.1 (tarball Thu May 28 04:56:48 EDT 2015)
Copyright (C) 2002-2014 Novell, Inc, Xamarin Inc and Contributors. www.mono-project.com
```

```
Linux CENTURION 4.0.4-303.fc22.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu May 28 12:37:06 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

data.title: Fix stupid typo in the Makefile
data.body: I'll go crawl under a rock now.

data.title: Added soviet05
data.body:
Hi guys, so this map is now completed. Consider this somewhat "beta" version. I plan to gather your opinions, bugs and other comments and also for fixing harvester logic (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8446).

Important information:
-3 levels of difficulty, on hard AI Expands on Island right waway, Easy decreases size/increases interval of reinforcements.
-#8446 evaded by creating a Refinery next to the orefield and deleting on 1st tick after harv is intialized.
-AI is able to build it's base on the Island and even rebuild it, but there are some bugs that need more coding/are hard to implement and will be open to discussion, namely: AI can place the next building that is currently being produced after the CYard is destroyed. AI doesn't need money to build (it has two refineries and it loses the money, just doesn't checks if he has enough), it's building queue works as in original - no parallel building of defensive structures.
-AI produces units as it should
-Second MCV can be aquired by entering the western side of the island after the Radar is captured

Feel free to post anything relevant to future development so I can deliver a version for next stable.

PS. Thanks to abcdefg30 and also other guys who were willing to help me with lua and git!

data.title: Fixes regression with selection classes
data.body:
Fixes regression from #8212, as @Phrohdoh remarked:
Select all units on screen should use selection priorities to determine who actually gets selected. I have falsely understood the function of this command to be selecting all units that belong to the current player no matter the selection priorities.
